radiographic_examinations.findings: The visualized lung bases are clear, without pleural or pericardial effusion. Normal liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands. Kidneys are symmetric and normal in size. Fluid-filled retrocecal appendix measuring up to 8 mm with hyperemic thickened walls; hyperemia and wall thickening of the cecal base. Right lower quadrant mesenteric lymph nodes are prominent but not pathologically enlarged. No abdominal aortic aneurysm, and pelvic organs are within normal limits.
